profile.name: Javier
profile.title: Technically-minded manager, people-oriented engineer.
profile.description:
My name is Javier, and I love coding.

I got my first computer when I was 9. At some point in my teens, I decided to become a physicist, but after getting the degree I started working as a software developer.

Coding is what I love, but what I do really well is helping teams of developers perform at their best. This is something that took me several years to figure out, working as a junior developer, senior developer, project manager, product manager, operations manager, and some other roles with different combinations of technical and managerial responsibilities.

My current areas of interest include transitioning teams to working with clean architectures (using DDD and hexagonal architecture), levering the cloud through AWS managed services, and building teams that own a whole business domain, from feature conception to production.

I love trying new languages, even if I don't have enough time to become an expert. Just changing paradigms is a lot of fun.

interestingFacts.fact: Real Club Deportivo de La Coruña. Also, some NBA team with a European star (currently Dallas Mavericks)

Sinclair ZX-81.
No graphics, no monitor, no keyboard, 1KB of RAM. A wonderful machine.

challenges.description:
I lead Netex Tech Leads to discuss the right approach for the different
architectural challenges in our applications: authentication,
asynchronous communications, cloud-oriented development…

I promote DDD and hexagonal architecture among the developers.

I coordinate the migration to AWS of Netex products based on managed
services rather than EC2-based lift and shift instances.

I am in charge of the development and IT departments of Redegal. I plan
and monitor the day-to-day running of these departments, and their
interactions with other departments, both in Spain and Mexico.

Most of the teams are focused on eCommerce tools (Magento,
PrestaShop, Shopify, WooCommerce), hosted in a private cloud managed
by the IT team, or, in some cases, in AWS. But we also have some
non-eCommerce projects with Node.js and Java.

I'm also involved in some of the accounts, providing support to the
project managers, collaborating with sales, and helping with our client's
strategic goals

I am a Product Owner for a Saas eLearning tool. I gather information
from our clients, internal users, and management to build user stories
and prioritize the backlog.

I help the Scrum Master and the development team with the transition to
a self-organized team, and I also mentor some members to help them
work as a team.

Some of the technical tasks are: reviewing the architectures used in the
different applications, improving the delivery pipeline, and evaluating the
right technologies for the new version of the application.
